intro: Phlegmariurus weddellii, commonly known as Weddell's haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hair-like leaf structure and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant forms dense, cushion-like mats and is often seen in temperate and subarctic regions. Its reproductive structures, called capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. Phlegmariurus weddellii plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
